title: Boris Johnson tells a porky
text:
The Eton-educated Boris Johnson clearly didn't spend long enough in the East End to master the local lingo | Kirsty Wigglesworth/WPA Pool via Getty Images Boris Johnson tells a porky Why the prime minister should get on the dog and bone to his Chinas before opening his north and south.

As a former London mayor, it's a fair bet Boris Johnson has heard of Cockney rhyming slang, but the Eton-educated Tory leader clearly didn't spend long enough in the East End to master the local lingo.

If he had, the prime minister would realize that his example of a culinary, er, delicacy that would benefit from a U.K.-U.S. trade deal was bound to prompt titters among real Londoners (ie. not Taylor Swift).

As he would have known if he had got on the "dog" (dog and bone = phone) to one of his "Chinas" (China plates = mates) in London before opening his "north and south" (= mouth), "pork pies" is Cockney rhyming slang for lies.

Promising to "prise open the American market" for the round jelly and pastry-encased pork slabs in talks with Donald Trump at the G7 summit in Biarritz, Johnson said they're already "sold in Thailand and Iceland." That was news to the Melton Mowbray Pork Pie Association, which put the record straight on BBC radio (and thanked the PM for putting pies on the G7 agenda alongside global warming and the trade war). Government officials said Johnson's remarks were "based on a briefing note from the Department for International Trade."

In the East End, they'll be having a real "bubble" (bubble bath = laugh) about it over a "pig's ear" (= beer) down the "rub-a-dub" (= pub). Of course, nobody actually talks like that, but it is common for Londoners to chuck a bit of rhyming slang when having a "rabbit" (rabbit and pork = talk), as Johnson knows — unless he's totally "mutton" (Mutt 'n Jeff = deaf).

The prime minister, who had a reputation for porkies in his earlier incarnation as a journalist, is unlikely to lose any "bo-peep" (= sleep) over it. After all, he's made a career out of talking "Eartha" (Eartha Kitt = I think you've got the hang of it by now).
description: Why the prime minister should get on the dog and bone to his Chinas before opening his north and south.
